sentences.sContent: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.sCn: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.sContent: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.sCn: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.sContent: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.sCn: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.sContent: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.sCn: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

sentences.sContent: ...In a flash of temper he or she may upset fellow workers or customers,causing a direct or indirect loss to the organization...
...yet the chart of Weekly earnings in 2010 reveals a forceful counter-evidence that the income is in direct proportion to one's educational background...
...Respect is shown by looking in the general direction but avoiding direct eye contact...
...she noticed that the candidate never made direct eye contact...
...Direct mail A final advertising medium is direct mail...
...Some hired flag wavers to direct customers to empty parking spaces...

synos.tran: 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的
直接地；正好；按直系关系

phrases.pCn: n. 外国直接投资，对外直接投资
直接喷射；直接注入；直接射出法

words.tran: 定向的；经指导的；被控制的
没有方向的；没有目标的
直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地
主任，主管；导演；人事助理
方向；指导；趋势；用法说明
[计] 目录；工商名录；姓名地址录
定向性，方向性；方向感知
定向性；指令性；趋向或趋势的确定性
指导；管理（direct的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between
